meanings.definition: Capable of burning, corroding, or destroying living tissue.
meanings.sent1: The caustic chemicals in the lab should be handled with care.
meanings.sent2: The caustic liquid spilled on the floor, causing a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent3: The caustic solution seemed to have a grudge against the metal, eating it away.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like caustic acid, slowly eroding his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The caustic nature of the substance was evident from the smoke it emitted.

meanings.definition: Severely critical or sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way.
meanings.sent1: His caustic remarks left everyone feeling hurt and upset.
meanings.sent2: The caustic review of the movie was harsh but fair.
meanings.sent3: The caustic wit of the comedian had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: She had a caustic tongue that could cut through any argument.
meanings.sent5: The caustic tone of his voice made it clear he was not pleased.
